intro: Dichondra sericea var. sericea, commonly known as silverleaf dichondra, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It features small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ground cover. Its rapid growth and ability to tolerate drought conditions make it a versatile plant for landscaping and erosion control.
